results.title: Jack and the beanstalk
results.brief_description: A short version of the traditional fairy tale in a new medium of silhouette-color, in which black cut-out puppets are manipulated against a colored background. A recent variation on Lotte Reiniger’s established techniques. Narrated by Deryck Guyler.

results.title: [Taronga Park; Sydney Harbour Bridge; The Great Barrier Reef; Peeping at Perth]
results.creator_credit: Eric Merton, Kodak Cinegraph and Perier Films
results.brief_description:
This film contains four short tourism films edited together, possibly by Ted Parsons.

The first film shows Taronga Zoological Park in Sydney, New South Wales, which was opened to the public in 1916 as a popular tourist destination. The segment shows various species of animals, in particular Australian marsupials (including kangaroos and koalas) and reptiles (including a goanna and a green python). The animals are introduced with title cards.

The second section of film shows the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney beaches. The film shows the arched bridge, including views from the top of it, as well as surfing at Bondi, coastal views of Palm Beach and surf lifesaving at Manly.

The third segment shows close-ups of rockpools by the Great Barrier Reef, including crustaceans, sea snails and starfish. It also shows wildlife, including birds and turtles, along the beaches in Queensland.

In the fourth section, the highlights of Perth, Western Australia are shown. The film shows views across the Perth city, King’s Park, the buildings in London Court and the grand buildings of the University of Western Australia.

results.title: Blackmagic Design Media Preservation Lab
results.brief_description: The Media Preservation Lab is a purposed built public facing lab.
results.description: There are about 250,000 artefacts in the ACMI Collection. We’ve been collecting film, videogames, artworks, home movies, stills and press kits – as well as a huge range of other paraphernalia – for over 75 years, ever since ACMI was conceived as a film lending and education organisation known as the State Film Centre. Inside the Blackmagic Media Preservation Lab, our staff and collaborators are digitising our film and time-based media collections, assessing physical artefacts from our videogame collection and film donations, as well as conducting hours of quality assessment work on our born-digital works to make the collection accessible onsite and online.
description_for_label: There are about 250,000 artefacts in the ACMI Collection, which we’ve been collecting for over 75 years – ever since ACMI was conceived as a film lending and education organisation called the State Film Centre. In the Blackmagic Media Preservation Lab, we’re digitising our film and time-based media collections, assessing physical artefacts from our videogame collection and film donations, as well as making the collection accessible onsite and online.

results.title: 10 Easy ways to lose your job
results.creator_credit: Tom Colello, Donna Boundy and Reelizations
results.brief_description: Short vignettes illustrate the most common mistakes young people make when they are new to the workforce. These include: calling into work sick at the last minute, chronic lateness, not following instructions and less devious forms of stealing such as taking goods and services from the store or office. There is also an emphasis on attitude and how this affects customer service.
